Workout day. Today: triceps, shoulders and back again. They are my weak points and will need a few weeks of focus to catch up.

Image courtesy of MidJourney
I hope you all had a happy Christmas, some good family time and lots of good food.
Sneaking in a little Christmas‚Äôs workout before the festivities. Back, shoulders and triceps today.
Good morning. I think I‚Äôll do a fasting day today. Seems appropriate before stuffing myself over Christmas.
And as I slip into bed, I realize, it is indeed Friday the 13th. Good night.

item.title: Petition zur Widerspruchsregelung f√ºr Organspenden
item.description:
Im Augenblick ist eine Petition am laufen die sich f√ºr eine Widerspruchsl√∂sung f√ºr Organspende einsetzt. Als jemand der auf ein neues Organ wartet, w√§re ich f√ºr jede Unterschrift pers√∂nlich dankbar.

Je mehr Menschen die Petition unterst√ºtzen, desto gr√∂√üer ist die Wahrscheinlichkeit, dass sie Erfolg hat.

Hier k√∂nnt ihr mehr erfahren und unterzeichnen:

‚ÜíWiderspruchsregelung f√ºr Organspenden

Vielen Dank!

Alexander

This weekend we had our little Christmas market in Geinsheim. MY wife had a stand to inform about the Bewegungspark project and it was a great success. Lots of people came by to get informed about the project and its status. Lots of donations. And overall great feedback.
Want to read: How to Do Nothing: Resisting the Attention Economy by Jenny Odell üìö
No idea why people constantly fiddle with cross-posting and what to post to which service. Seems like a whole lot of busywork to me.

I get that different people have different needs. I for one am perfectly happy with the way Micro.blog works. I have enabled cross-posting and it just works.

The only thing actually broken for me is iOS notifications. I simply don‚Äôt get any.

I now have my own Python module to write Safari WebArchives. Neat. And not too hard to implement.

So now Links also saves a WebArchive copy and triggers a Wayback savepoint.

I now have my own Python module to write Safari WebArchives. Neat. And not too hard to implement.

So now Links also saves a WebArchive copy and triggers a Wayback savepoint.
Would you believer it? Not a single mention since I installed the Micro.blog beta build with a fix for notifications. Help me out here folks. Give me some love.

I rewrote my webcatcher Python script yesterday. It is now leaner, meaner and more resilient against failed downloads. Links is coming together nicely. Pretty much all that is left is a nicer CSS for mobile devices and a web daemon so I can send stuff to Links from my iPhone.

I rewrote my webcatcher Python script yesterday. It is now leaner, meaner and more resilient against failed downloads. Links is coming together nicely. Pretty much all that is left is a nicer CSS for mobile devices and a web daemon so I can send stuff to Links from my iPhone.
Trying to decide between Trafilatua, Newspaper 4K and Readabilty for my Markdown and PDF creation.

item.title: Links Update
item.description:
Links, my barebones bookmark and archival solution is slowly getting better.

Today I redid the CSS or started to. I still need to reimplement breakpoints for smaller devices.

Also I finally put the project under Git version control. Version control really is a godsend. The initial learning curve is not nothing. But once you get it, it‚Äôs awesome.

I still need to polish the Python script a bit and make it more error resilient. And then I need to set up a web service for it so I can add links easily via iOS Shortcut.

Slowly getting there. Bit by bit.

item.title: Please help me find good anime
item.description:
My son is into anime these days. But he‚Äôs watching what I can only describe as garbage.

Either it‚Äôs Pok√©mon style stuff like Hunter x Hunter. People standing around discussing attack modifiers and just a whiff off a story.

Or it‚Äôs full bosomed schoolgirls giggling into the camera.

Are there no modern anime with proper story and at least a modicum of style?

In my day I was watching stuff like Princess Mononoke, Ninja Scroll or Vampire Hunter D to name a few. Is there nothing liked that out there today on Amazon Prime or Crunchyroll?
And boom goes the FDP.

I spent most of today setting up Sublime Text and PyLint. Also researched what alternatives there are to Sphinx.

I also studied some of my old code to remember how to do things like setting up a proper logger and traceback.

It‚Äôs a little frustrating that I already knew all this once.

First version of Links is online! It is still missing a few things and needs more polish, but it works.

‚Üí Links‚Äîa barebones bookmark and archival solution

First version of Links is online! It is still missing a few things and needs more polish, but it works.

‚Üí Links‚Äîa barebones bookmark and archival solution
I just checked Links v1.0.0 into my Git repository. Almost ready to deploy!
I just checked Links v1.0.0 into my Git repository. Almost ready to deploy!

Just a quick reminder that I have an Etsy store with unused designs from past projects. They make great presents for the holidays. Especially the gnome ones.

Also on orders of ‚Ç¨50 or more you will get 25% off for the next two weeks.

‚Üí BD ScribbleWear

Slow progress on Links today. I didn‚Äôt have much time and spent what little I had chasing syntax errors. Here‚Äôs to a more successful tomorrow. I‚Äôm planning on getting my delete function working, add per user link databases, and add a dummy links collection for when you are not signed in.

Slow progress on Links today. I didn‚Äôt have much time and spent what little I had chasing syntax errors. Here‚Äôs to a more successful tomorrow. I‚Äôm planning on getting my delete function working, add per user link databases, and add a dummy links collection for when you are not signed in.

Programming can be really annoying when you are having a dense moment. I was searching for a syntax error for probably two hours all in all only to have someone else tell me I was missing a bracket somewhere. Sigh.

When someone sends me an audio message, my reply will always be to send me a text instead. I have no patience to listen to your rambling to parse what you want to say. Editing your thoughts into something meaningful worth sharing is your job. Not mine.
Man. I‚Äôm so happy I am not on that Facebook train. So many dopes over there.

Current status of Links, my barebones bookmark and archival tool:

  • creating links via the site works
  • the site now also offers a Markdown preview
  • Markdown and PDF are saved as cleaned up versions

Still to do:

  • make the archive script more robust
  • delete links from the website
  • some CSS design work

Current status of Links, my barebones bookmark and archival tool:

  • creating links via the site works
  • the site now also offers a Markdown preview
  • Markdown and PDF are saved as cleaned up versions

Still to do:

  • make the archive script more robust
  • delete links from the website
  • some CSS design work

My lack of PHP knowledge makes me run against walls in my little website project. I am making headway, but slowly. Had a little breakthrough just now. I‚Äôd love to continue, but need to take a break and prepare lunch.

item.title: Links - a bookmarking/archival project
item.description:
I am getting closer to a working version of my own little bookmarking/archiving project. I tried Archivebox, Linkwarden, linkding and of course Pinboard and Raindrop. None of them quite did what I wanted. So I rolled up my sleeves and got to work.

Current state:

  • save a given URL as PDF, Markdown and Web Archive (Warco)
  • a basic website displaying the saved links with a URL and a summary of the site as well as links to the archived files.

It is very bare bones right now, but it works. Also, and this is one of the big pluses for me, no tags, no categories. Just a list of links.

To be done:

  • CSS styling of the link list
  • a way to add links from the site
  • a way to add links on the go
  • a way to delete links on the site
  • search

sag mal spinn ich oder hatte die Feeds Liste mal Favicons? Ich hab schon alle Settings durch und finde aber nichts was das Fehlen erkl√§ren k√∂nnte.

Cc @voidstern@graz.social

I am getting closer to a working version of my own little bookmarking/archiving project. I tried Archivebox, Linkwarden, linkding and of course Pinboard and Raindrop. None of them quite did what I wanted. So I rolled up my sleeves and got to work.

My new water rower. It is great fun to use and our son loves it too. Since he usually is a couch potato this is a huge win for us.

item.title: AI Coding
item.description:
After reading about GitHub Spark I felt inspired to see how good programming with an AI works.

So I set about using Claude 3.5 Haiku to write a little Python program that archives a give URL as PDF, Markdown and saves a bunch of metadata along as well as summarizes the page with GPT4.

It took a bit of noodling and back an forth with the AI to smooth out the functionality and the errors I got. But I didn‚Äòt code anything myself. Only copied and pasted a few code corrections here and there that the AI gave me.

And it works. I think I will continue on this path and make my own version of Archivebox.
Today my water rower arrives. I can‚Äòt wait to set it up.
I prepped the first one shot of Chaosium‚Äòs new book No Time to Scream in Foundry VTT for a friend and I. We played it yesterday to great fun. Highly recommended.
Oh wow. Foundry have EOL‚Äòed Modo.
I‚Äòve treated myself to a water rowing machine this week. A Sportstech WRX1000 is headed my way next week. I can hardly await it.

item.title: Please help me find a knowledge dump/retrieval solution
item.description:
I am looking for a solution for my wife, who is not technically minded. So the solution should be very simple to use. I am looking for a way for her to collect and retrieve information with as little friction as possible.

Basically a way to dump websites, PDFs, images, emails or other text into a folder or application and then easily retrieve the information back with a search.

  • The workflow should work without having to structure the dumped knowledge, but it may allow structuring.
  • It might allow annotation.
  • Ideally it works without locking to a specific software or file format.
  • Also it should work within Apple‚Äòs ecosystem, specifically iOS.

I fully expect riots when the US election results come out. The way Trump has already pushed the stolen election narrativeve you can bet that his followers will not accept a Harris win. It is going to get ugly.
‚ÄûGo and vote. It could be your last.‚Äú Had me in tears at the end. youtu.be/6bTpbDL5d…
Anyone else using DayOne and Micro.blog? Do you keep them separate? Combine them somehow? What‚Äôs your workflow?
Diving into Call of Cthulhu setup options for Foundry VTT. Sometimes I enjoy game prep more then actually playing.
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->

Chaosium and HumbleBundle have a massive Call of Cthulhu sale going, which supports the World Wildlife Fund. Go grab yourself some Lovecraftian Horror for an incredible price. I did.

I also got myself a copy of the new three one-shot adventure book No Time to Scream.
The interesting thing about Trump is that he is unable to speak the truth about pretty much anything he says, while also speaking the plain truth about what what he is going to do when in office.
Home at Last!
And I‚Äôm on my last leg home sitting in the RE from Karlsruhe to Neustadt. The whole trip was smooth and without delays.
Second leg of the journey has started without delay. On the IC to Karlsruhe for the next two hours.
Currently listening to: Project Hail Mary: A Novel by Andy Weir üìö for the second time. I love the narration and the story.
And thus my trip back home begins. On the ICE to N√ºrnberg now.

Zur√ºck vom Klassentreffen. Zirka 48 von 108 Klassenkameraden sind erschienen und die meisten kannte ich sogar noch. Es war schon die alte Truppe wiederzusehen. Im Grunde als w√§ren nicht 25 Jahre vergangen. Fast alle waren noch immer die selben. Vom Aussehen, der Mode, dem Verhalten. Faszinierend.
Wow. Just wow

item.title: Magic Links Are a Bad Idea
item.description:
John Gruber in his piece DHH Argues Against Passkeys

Also, I really dislike the practice of replacing passwords with email ‚Äúmagic links‚Äù. Autofilling a password from my keychain happens instantly; getting a magic link from email can take minutes sometimes, and even in the fastest case, it‚Äôs nowhere near instantaneous. Replacing something very fast ‚Äî password autofill ‚Äî with something slower is just a terrible idea. For people who actually prefer email magic links, it‚Äôs fine as an option, but it shouldn‚Äôt be the default, and it certainly shouldn‚Äôt be the only way to sign into an account.

I have to agree. Magic links are more annoying then helpful. I‚Äòd like them to be an option and not the norm. I‚Äòve had more then one occasion where I had to trigger a magic link several times before it arrived in my inbox. A simple email/password login would have been much more reliable and quicker.
I just treated myself to a Combustion Predictive Thermometer & Display. So many use cases. I cannot wait to try it.
Finally on route to my destination.

Forced layover in Munich. The signage was stupid and led me to walk along the train I was supposed to get on. By the time the signage was clear, the train I was walking alongside of the whole time closed its doors and left.
Breakfast time
Starting my trip to Regensburg. Weather is decent. Not too cold and dry.

item.title: Der Idioten-Apostroph
item.description: Die Apostroph-Debatte: Anscheinend wird mal wieder die deutsche Sprache aufgeweicht. Der possessive Apostroph existiert im Deutschen eigentlich nicht‚Ä¶au√üer bei Eigennamen, wenn es um den Besitz geht. In diesem Fall ist er nat√ºrlich erlaubt. Gut gemacht, Rat f√ºr deutsche Rechtschreibung‚Äîmal wieder wurde eine eindeutige und klare Regel aufgeweicht.

item.title: School Reunion
item.description:
I am leaving for our gymnasium reunion in two days. I haven’t seen any of my old school friends in at least ten years. I’ve never been much of a social person; while I enjoy the company of friends, I’m not particularly good at keeping in touch.

So, I am essentially meeting a bunch of strangers in four days. I’m not very good at social gatherings where I don’t know anyone, so I’m unsure how I feel about the reunion. On one hand, I’m looking forward to it; on the other, I’m really dreading it.

My health situation doesn’t help to make me feel less awkward. Having a stiff neck that is locked at an angle, making my most comfortable stance one that looks at people’s crotches, is, well, suboptimal.
Live from the Neustadter Winzerumzug
Winzerumzug is about to start
Neust√§dter Winzerumzug is about to start. About 80.000 visitors expected.

I am tempted to get Procreate Dreams and animate a bit again. I haven‚Äòt animated in almost two decades. But I‚Äòd need to replace my lost Apple Pen first and I can‚Äôt bring myself to spend another ‚Ç¨140 on it.

My Paper cursor didn‚Äôt only do backflip while it was bored waiting for my input. When I came back from a longer break it was sitting there asleep with big üí§‚Äòs coming from it. I love the whimsy even more because how reduced the app is.
I wrote my first long form post today with Paper. It was pure fun. What a great no nonsense writing app.

item.title: My Current Setup
item.description:
I thought I‚Äôd write down my current workflow setup since it has changed drastically since I last wrote about it. Not only am I exclusively working from home these days‚Äîdue to health reasons‚Äîbut I am also working in a very reduced capacity. This means I am mostly using my iPhone, iPad, and iMac for leisure.

With that being said, here is what I use on a daily basis.

Keeping up with the Joneses

Micro.blog

I said goodbye to social media a while ago. While I was quite active on Twitter and even more so on App.net and Slack, I have since dropped all of these. There really isn’t much point in spinning my wheels there.

These days, I post to my own blog, which is syndicated to the Micro.blog timeline and also cross-posted to Mastodon. I’m not active on Mastodon, but thanks to the Fediverse, any replies I receive on Mastodon should appear on my Micro.blog timeline.

Posting to my blog is done via the Micro.blog app or website, which is very frictionless for the most part.

  • My Micro.blog Account
  • My website
  • My Fediverse ID: @alex@alexanderkucera.com

Fiery Feeds and FeedBin

For my daily news, I tend to watch the local news show Tagesthemen while eating breakfast. This keeps me up to date on both local and global news and politics.

For my tech news and other updates, I use Feedbin to curate my feeds and Fiery Feeds for reading them. Fiery Feeds has a few nice intelligent curation options, like Hot Links or Long and Short articles, that make it easy to catch up on too many RSS feeds every day. Yes, maybe I should subscribe to fewer feeds, but with Fiery Feeds, I really don‚Äôt have to.

Overcast

Every couple of years, I switch podcast apps. I used to be an avid user of Pocket Casts, and Castro was my favorite player for years. These days, I am back with Overcast. I don‚Äôt have any special feelings for it; it works well.

YouTube

Sadly, I am a sucker for YouTube videos. I do not browse the auto-suggestions much, but I have way too many subscriptions. At the moment, my ‚ÄûWatch Later‚Äú queue contains 24 items, most of which are in the 20-30 minute range. However, there are a few videos that are 1.5-3 hours long that I haven‚Äôt gotten around to watching.

Discord

While I don‚Äôt engage much on Discord, I follow a few servers to get news announcements and participate in one or two in-person chats. The days when I was active daily for several hours on Slack and Discord are long gone.

Health related

MacroFactor

I recently started using MacroFactor to track my food and water intake. I have been on and off the food-tracking wagon in the past; usually, I track for a week or two before stopping again. The apps I have used in the past, like Lifesum and MyFitnessPal, are all nice and work reasonably well with tracking EU foods. However, they all miss a crucial element: they don‚Äôt adapt to one‚Äôs personal habits; they simply track food.

MacroFactor, on the other hand, adapts to your eating habits, providing you with tailored goals and occasionally coaching you on what you can improve or change. It simply clicks with me much more than all the other apps I have tried.

RP Hypertrophy

About a year ago, I finally accepted that I needed to build some strength to get my life back. Due to severe health-related issues, I pretty much stopped moving around 2016. I didn‚Äôt blow up, but I lost nearly all my muscle. Moving around the house became a chore at times. Combined with some serious joint inflammation, this kept me sedentary.

No more. I started slowly to build muscle again. At first, I went too quickly, which resulted in weeks of not being able to work out due to inflamed joints. However, in combination with MacroFactor, I have been able to manage my food intake in a way that reduces inflammation while providing enough protein and energy to rebuild my strength.

The RP Hypertrophy app has been my steadfast companion. There are other exercise apps out there‚Äîsome cheaper, some more expensive, and some even free‚Äîbut none of them resonate with me like the RP Hypertrophy app does. The way it allows me to quickly set up a training plan is unparalleled. It also helps me with my progression by analyzing my workout volume. Great! One less thing to think about.

RP Strength also has a Diet Coach app, but for me, MacroFactor works better.

Writing

Paper

I recently stumbled across Paper as a writing tool, and I really, really like it. I haven‚Äôt quite found the justification to pay for it yet. It comes with a hefty price tag in my region (the developer consciously charges more in richer regions of the world). However, I might consider it in the future, depending on whether I start writing professionally again in the coming months. For now, I‚Äôm going the cheapskate route and clicking away the nag screens that pop up now and again. Sorry, Mihhail!

Textastic

I don‚Äôt use Textastic for actual writing, but it is a great general text editor if I need to edit something from my iCloud, modify a file on my server, or whip up a quick Python script or other scripts.

AirMail

My email client of choice is AirMail. There‚Äôs not much to say about it, really. It works for me.

Apps by Readdle

I use several apps from the Ukrainian developer Readdle. They tend to deliver a polished experience, and their support is excellent.

Calendars

Their calendar solution is top-notch. It supports natural language event creation, the UI is nice, and it works better for me than the native Calendar app on iOS.

Scanner

Their document scanner works in a very no-nonsense way. It offers great support for de-skewing and straightening out your wonky document photos. It provides automatic OCR and document naming, and you can create workflows‚Äîsomething I haven‚Äôt taken advantage of yet, as my needs aren‚Äôt that complex.

PDF Expert

Their PDF reader works great. You can edit and annotate PDFs. Sadly, there is no OCR on iOS or iPadOS yet, but I am told it‚Äôs coming.

Strongbox

I used to be a strong 1Password supporter. I bought it way back when I got my first iPhone‚Äîan iPhone 4. Since then, I have bought several updates, and when they switched to a subscription model, I purchased the family plan for‚ÄîI think‚Äîtwo years.

Then I read a thread on Micro.blog where someone talked about Strongbox. I checked it out, installed it, and took advantage of their very generous three-month trial. After a week or so of use, they had won me over, and I happily paid for their lifetime license after the trial period was over.

Granted, using Strongbox is a little bit more complicated and less streamlined than using 1Password, but their lifetime license costs what I used to pay for 1Password in a year. There is simply no comparison when it comes to value per euro.

AI

Perplexity

I use Perplexity for searching most of the time instead of doing a Google or DuckDuckGo search. I enjoy getting nicely written summarized results, and if I want to dig deeper, I can simply open the sources Perplexity found for a given topic. I haven‚Äôt found any instances where the AI hallucinated an answer, but there have been a few occasions where the suggested follow-up questions were just nonsense.

TypingMind

TypingMind is a great ChatGPT interface that allows me to use most ChatGPT features without shelling out over $20 a month. It connects via the ChatGPT API, which results in much more reasonable costs. I got myself a premium license and haven‚Äôt looked back since.

MidJourney

Generative Imaging. Some people loathe it; I personally love it. MidJourney is great for quickly generating dozens of variations on an idea, especially since they enabled generation via the website instead of in a Discord chat. We have used it to rapidly create initial drafts and, yes, even final designs for projects, both professional and private.

Graphics

Affinity Designer 2

Since I have mostly stepped back from work, we primarily focus on occasional graphic design for local projects, such as flyers, postcards, roll-up flags, and the like.

Affinity Designer is unbeatable in terms of price and the value it offers for this purpose. Additionally, we can use it on the iPad for initial mockups and then continue working on the same file on the Mac. Brilliant!

Affinity Photo 2

It‚Äôs pixel-related brother, Affinity Photo, while not as intuitive and powerful as Photoshop, is still nevertheless our main go-to when it comes to editing images. Plus, it works well together with Designer and also offers the same iPad-to-Mac and back workflow.

QR Factory

Since we switched to a more graphic design-based workflow, we regularly need to create QR codes. While there are many online and free generators available, QR Factory offers a comprehensive suite of QR options in one package. I wouldn‚Äôt consider using any other option anymore.

Nuke

Foundry‚Äôs Nuke is my main workhorse for paid work. Although I don‚Äôt do as much as I once did, I am still very happy to pay for an Indie license when the occasional project comes in. Nuke remains the gold standard for compositing.

Modo

Similarly, when I need to do some 3D work, I use my trusty copy of Foundry‚Äôs modo. It still gets me everywhere I need to go‚Äîthough these days, that isn‚Äôt very far.

Outbank

For banking in Germany, this is the way to go. Outbank has the best banking support of any app I‚Äôve tried in the past. The developers had some negative press a couple of years ago related to pricing, subscriptions, and a completely revamped UI design, but I think they have recovered well from that.

For my money, this is the best way to keep track of your money, at least for European/German users.

Etsy and Printful

I recently discovered Printful, and it got me interested enough to open our own little Etsy store with designs from the cutting room floor. I mean, why let perfectly good doodles and scribbles go to waste?‚Äú

IT

FE File Explorer

FE File Explorer is my go-to app when the Files app on iOS won‚Äôt suffice. It is also a great FTP client and integrates nicely with our online workflow.

ShellFish

ShellFish is my preferred SSH client. I have tried a few others in the past, but ShellFish has really stuck with me. It also integrates nicely with Files.app.
Did my Paper cursor really just make a backflip while it was waiting for me to enter some text‚ÄΩ
It looks like people really enjoy the gnome prints in our new Etsy store.

item.title: Dental Cleaning
item.description:
So, I went to the dentist today to get a dental cleaning. My last dental cleaning was about six months ago, and the one before that was about three years prior. I was told last time that because the time between cleanings was so long, the cleaning took over an hour and that I should go more often.

So that’s what I did. And guess what? The cleaning still took over an hour. Not only that, but there was a 50% price increase since last time.

50%!

I wish I could increase my rates by 50%. That is ten times the current inflation rate. Ridiculous. I think I‚Äôll take my chances and spread apart the cleanings to every other year again, because I do not see the value in getting this done every six months.
Ah, the Paper Markdown paragraph behavior is actually configurable in the Settings.
Does anyone have any experience with light therapy devices like the Lumie? I am on the fence of ordering one for this winter season.

item.title: Bear App Test
item.description:
This is a test of the Bear app for writing and note taking. So it turns out Bear does not publish to Micro.blog. Also the writing environment is not nearly as neat as Paper, even when I hide all the UI.

One advantage Bear has is that is supports images and other file formats in the notes. However, since it does not publish to Micro.blog that is of no help there as I still need to upload first and then include the link to the media file.

This is an online image test:

And Bear seems to suffer from the same thing that plagues Bear. It does not export paragraphs properly. Or at least it treats paragraphs in the app differently then on export. A Markdown paragraph is denoted by a blank line between bodies of text. Both Paper and Bear show a simple line-break as new paragraph, but on export the paragraphs get lost due to no extra line break being added. Not terribly hard to work around, but worth noting.

But then again, Bear is about a third of the yearly cost. Which makes the choice actually harder and not easier.

item.title: Paper Test
item.description:
This is a quick test about how the Paper app works. I recently read the Paper review by Erlend on his Havn blog, which lead to me reading the terrific three part series by the Paper developer on how Paper came together. It showed a level of care and detail that I highly appreciate.

So now here I am writing this in Paper and really enjoying the experience. I will compare this to Bear in another post. Both offer the ability to publish to Micro.blog as far as I can tell.

Two paragraphs in and Paper already shines. But it does come with a hefty price tag. Considering I don‚Äòt write professionally, it is a bit of a hard pillow to shallow. Let‚Äòs see how it goes in Bear.

Now a quick image test:

item.title: Testing Obsidian
item.description: I‚Äôm just playing around a both with Obsidian for iOS and how the Micro.blog integration works.
Today is fasting day and also workout day. I need to get my arm back in shape after it got a hole the size of a tennis ball cut into my triceps.
Our Etsy shop is online! Come by and check out our shirts. They are super comfy and they look great on you.
Prepping about 30 graphics for my new Etsy shop today.

item.title: Discovering Printful and Etsy
item.description:
I recently stumbled upon a fantastic combo during one of our projects: Printful and Etsy. Imagine my excitement when I realized I could turn the hidden scribbles and interim designs from BabylonDreams into something more than just digital clutter!

Why Printful and Etsy?

Etsy is like a treasure trove for unique, handmade items, and Printful? They’re the magical elves of print-on-demand, transforming our digital designs into physical products seamlessly.

Our New Etsy Shop

So, why not share our vibrant mix of styles and topics with the world? That’s exactly what we’re doing! From quirky sketches to bold, colorful designs perfect for t-shirts and mugs, our new Etsy shop will have a bit of everything for everyone.

Stay Tuned!

We’re almost ready to launch. I can’t wait to show you what we’ve cooked up. So, get ready to shop!
Mein Fitter Freitag - 2304ml Mit Waterllama hydriert und gl√ºcklich bleiben! üí¶ü¶ô Waterllama

Today‚Äôs lunch: homemade beef and veggie soup with maultaschen.

Soooo delicious.

No image today. Soup was gone faster then I was able to pull out my iPhone.

I‚Äòm thinking crispy fried potatoes with spinach, topped with a fried egg for today‚Äòs lunch.

(Image courtesy of MidJourney)

I felt the need to look into playing around with Kirby CMS‚Äîagain. I‚Äîonce again‚Äîlearned that it is not my world anymore. So I put away my old license files and deleted the project folder.

Micro.blog you have spoiled me.

item.title: Peter Pan - Tanzwerk Silvia Rumpf
item.description:
This weekend is our little one‚Äôs big performance. The ballet school is performing Peter Pan the whole weekend. Two full rehearsals on Friday and Saturday and then three two hour performances on Saturday and Sunday.

We are going to watch the one on Sunday noon. Which is about to start in about 30 minutes.

I‚Äôve seen pictures of the rehearsal and it looks great.

item.title: Rope Jumping
item.description: Today marks the start of me getting back into rope jumping. I actually wanted to start rowing, but I have no space for a rowing machine right now and I refuse to pay gym fees just to get access to a rowing machine. So rope jumping it will be for the foreseeable future. I just need to be uber-careful to start really slow to ease my joints into it. They do not like sudden and prolonged strain.
So that‚Äôs where they all went. Someone yelled ‚Äûcoffee and cake!‚Äú and suddenly they come all a-running.

So CleanUpDay came and went and only three people‚Äîmyself included‚Äîshowed up. That‚Äôs about 0,158% of the village population. Or really embarrassing how little people care about the place they live in.
Diesen Wochenende ist wieder CleanUpDay in Geinsheim. W√§re sch√∂n wenn viele mitmachen.

Today‚Äòs lunch: Z√ºrch‚Äòer Geschnetzeltes with rice.

(Image courtesy of MidJourney)

I just read Going old-school with the VFX on ‚ÄòBeverly Hills Cop: Axel F‚Äô - befores & afters. The VFX breakdown while interesting just shows what a waste of money it all is. I mean, how hard is it to spray a bit of water into Eddy Murphy‚Äòs face on set? Instead your blow your money on several artists having to do matchmoving and simulating and compositing for several days.

There is nothing ‚Äûold school‚Äú about any of it.

This whole new Reeder, old Reeder thing last week has pushed me to rediscover Fiery Feeds. It‚Äôs a great RSS reader that has a few intelligent folders that help surface articles in different ways.

I‚Äôve switched to it and haven‚Äôt looked back.
Does anyone reading this own the Chase Hughes Ops Manual or the whole OP6 Bundel? I am itching to get it, but am not sure it is worth the hefty price tag. Any reviews out there?

I just downgraded three Kickstarter pledges to digital versions instead of hardcover. As much as I love physical books, I’m saving for a bigger purchase and trying to avoid excess. Sometimes you have to admit you don‚Äôt really need something.

I remember now what the app from Realmac Software was called. Socialite. It got canned somewhere around 2012. But it was essentially what Tapestry and the new Reeder are trying to do. Back then I used it extensively. It was way ahead of its time.

Here is some info on it.

item.title: Stalking a public profile
item.description:
I overheard someone today. They confessed to stalking a singer on Instagram. What they meant was clearly that the follow them on Instagram.

Since when has it become a negative to follow someone on their public profile on Instagram?

Stalking is by definition to follow someone against their will and often in secret.

How can you stalk someone on social media when they have a public profile, indicating their willingness to be followed?"

item.title: The new Reeder is not for me
item.description:
I tried the new Reeder app yesterday for about 20 minutes before deleting it again. It just didn‚Äôt fit my needs at all. Or maybe I simply didn‚Äôt get it.

The idea of an endless scrolling timeline stresses me out. No unread count. You mean there is no indication of it ever ending? That sounds stress inducing to no end.

With my RSS reader (the now called Reeder Classic), I have a ton of feeds that are very high frequency that I only scan to see if something pops out. I have a folder called favorites that I scan more closely. At the end I mark both the ‚Äûfirehose‚Äú and the favorites as read. The posts disappear and I am at ease that I got the most important bits.

Then I open YouTube take a quick glance at what the homepage suggests. Usually junk. If there is something interesting it goes into my watch later queue. Then I scan my subscriptions. Same deal. Done.

I do this once a days in the morning. Once.

During the day I catch up on my Micro.blog feed, which is easy, becausee I only follow a couple of people compared to several hundreds I followed on Twitter.

I don‚Äôt need much morere then this. My past self probably would be all over Tapestry and the new Reeder. In fact, I did use a timeline aggregation app about ten years ago from Realmac Software that is no longer available and whose name I have forgotten. They were way ahead of their time back then. Maybe they should dust it off as well.
Zweite H√§lfte des Chorauftritts des Chorona Chors Kost√ºmwechsel.
Halbzeitpause beim Chorona Chor in Geinsheim. Bisher war mir das Programm erfrischend unbekannt. Der Chor singt gut und die Choreografie ist auch unterhaltsam.

item.title: Chorona Chor in der Kirche Geinsheim
item.description:
Heute singt der Chorona Chor in unserer Kirche.

Transcript
14 hours left on the Drive Book 4 Kickstarter. Production quality on the first three books was stellar. You can still get books 1-3 when you join in on the Kickstarter campaign.
I tried to use SubTXT. It failed at step one. Creating an outline from a story outline. It justt sat there spinning until I closed the tab and was done with it. Very disappointing.
For those who have played with 3D printing. Would you say it is still worth it to get one or would you rather use an online print service?

I find this whole Fediverse/Mastodon thing really confusing. For example, when trying to follow John Gruber, there are like 6 different accounts he has registered. Each of which seems to have different content. So am I supposed to have ten times the accounts I follow now just because everyone has a dozen different accounts spread over the internet?
Can someone explain the Rings of Power title sequence to me? To me it‚Äôs just meaningless particle animations. Do they make any kind of sense to anyone?
A great video showing what Ember is all about.
It looks like Ember is a huge success! Join on in to get an expansive roleplaying world to play in.
Bad Robots - Uberspace writes about the damage badly behaved web scraping bots do to hosters and their users.
Testing if the feed.json has been fixed.
It is almost time. Ember is launching in a few hours on Kickstarter. It is a new roleplaying game from the guys that create the brilliant Foundry VTT virtual tabletop roleplaying software.

With my whole sebaceous gland inflammation episode I had to (or opted to) take a break from weightlifting. It‚Äôs been two months this now and I started back up very lightly last week.

Today is a workout day. Week 2, day 1. Still very light weights and high reps (~30).

I‚Äôm already feeling better.
A receipt for another year of Micro.blog just came. Happy to pay it and support @manton Rock on Micro.blog!!
Based on today‚Äôs spam mails I‚Äôm a rich man. I was donated about ‚Ç¨7.500.00 today alone. Not bad.

item.title: Dave Kellett Original Art Drawing of Nosh for Sale
item.description:
Edit: This item has sold and found a new owner.

This original, signed, and numbered drawing of Nosh by Dave Kellett deserves to be displayed, not left collecting dust. It’s a piece that should shine on a wall or in a display case, but I no longer have the right space for it. With Dave’s blessing, I‚Äôm offering it up for sale.

I’m not looking to profit. These pieces usually go for around $100 on eBay. My only goal is to find a home where it‚Äôll be appreciated and displayed as it should be.

If you‚Äôre interested, drop me a message on Micro.blog or email me at [a.kucera@babylondreams.de](mailto: a.kucera@babylondreams.de) with an offer. I‚Äòll throw in a Drive Corps Mempership Card as well.

I quit Twitter a little over a year ago officially. Similarly I haven‚Äòt used any of the other services like Facebook, LinkedIn, Mastodon, Slack, Skype or any of the others.

I simply post to my blog now via Micro.blog. Occasionally I respond to a post on Micro.blog. That‚Äòs it. Other then that I live a life with the people around me. Family, friends, neighbors.

I don‚Äòt miss a thing. Social media can be intoxicating and make you feel like you miss a ton if you don‚Äòt constantly engage. This is a blatant lie you tell yourself. All you do is spinning your wheels while you could spend your time doing actually engaging or productive things.
Kinderflohmarkt auf der Geinsheimer Ludwigskerwe.
Der Kerwe-Umzug war ein Erfolg.
I stumbled over Perplexity today and I must say I‚Äôm impressed. I think this will be my default search engine for quick things to look up.
Der Kerwe-Umzug in Geinsheim startet jetzt.
KunstFerien in der [kantine16] sind heute zu Ende gegangen. Die Kinder haben stolz ihre Kunstwerke pr√§sentiert.
Heute startet die Geinsheimer Kerwe. Nachdem immer noch die 1250 Jahre gefeiert werden, ist dieses Jahr auch die Kerwe etwas besonderes. Kommt vorbei und feiert mit uns.

item.title: Wasting other people‚Äòs time‚Ä¶
item.description:
People that are inconsiderate with other people‚Äòs time piss me off to no end!

My wife regularly makes appointments for new children/parents. About 30% just never show up. No excuse. No call. Nothing. And about 10% of those have the gall to call a few days later for a second appointment (still no excuses).

And this is in a field where there is a shortage of spots for the kids. How entitled must you be to search for a nanny for your kid‚Äîof which there are to few‚Äîand then not show up?

Go fuck yourselves!

After a 3 month (!!!) free trial of Strongbox Pro, today I paid the ‚Ç¨80 for the lifetime Pro versions without batting an eyelid. Such great value compared to other more prominent password apps. I can highly recommend it.
Im [kantine16] in der N√§he vom Bahnhof Neustadt. Die Kinder haben hier f√ºnf Tage lang ‚ÄûKunstFerien‚Äú. Ich bin mal gespannt was am Ende der Woche rauskommt.
What‚Äôs up with all these Patreon recommendations I get all of a sudden from all my creators?
My two favorite Call of Cthulhu Keepers right now are Becca Scott ands Mark Meer.

Today was the first time my wife and my son were dressing my surgery wound. They both were really troopers. It‚Äôs not an easy a task since there is a large gaping hole in my upper arm they need to interact with. I‚Äôm not sure I could do it without them.
Watching Graveyards of Arkham a Call of Cthulhu story. Great cast, great keeper, great story.

Man getting your credit carded locked sucks. I have a ton of service badgering me right now about missing payments. And I missed out on a few things that I wanted to purchase at a discount. I really hope the new card arrives soon.
Still alive with a cut in my arm that stings like a mother. Fingers crossed it now heals without complications.
Yesterday‚Äòs 1250 years anniversary was a success. Thanks to everyone involved in setting this up and everyone that came and made it a great day.
New shirt. Get it from Michael. His shirts are great quality.
It has started. Geinsheim‚Äôs 1250 years anniversary kicks off with an open air service.

item.title: 1250 Jahre Geinsheim
item.description:
Das einmalige Erlebnis üåü

Historischer Feldgottesdienst im Innenhof der Fronm√ºhle

Wann üï∞Ô∏è: 4.8. um 10 Uhr Shuttelservice f√ºr Senioren üõ∫: von der Kirche Geinsheim zur Fronm√ºhle um 9:15Uhr, 9:30Uhr und 9:45Uhr - weitere Shuttles im Stundentakt mit Hin- und R√ºckfahrm√∂glichkeit.

Um 10 Uhr startet der historische Festakt zur üåü1250 üåüJahrfeier mit dem Feldgottesdienst ‚õ™Ô∏è im Innenhof der Fronm√ºhle. Der Gottesdienst dreht sich Rund ums Thema Ernte üåªüåæ und bietet Gro√ü und Klein die M√∂glichkeit zum Mitmachen. Lassen Sie sich von traditionellem bis modernen Liedgut verzaubern in entspannter Atmosph√§re‚ú®.

Danach gibts die M√∂glichkeit die Festmeile üåªüêëü´èüêÇ zu erkunden oder einfach sitzenbleiben und Fr√ºhschoppen üçª starten.

Ein Event bei dem jeder willkommen ist. Kommt vorbei, wir freuen uns auf euch!

Euer 1250 Feldgottesdienst Team! See less ‚Äî feeling blessed.

I simply do not understand the US republican mindset. There is no ‚Äútrying to emphatically view it through their eyes‚Äù. How‚Äîfor example‚Äîcan you claim to stand for Christian values and then spew hate about immigrants? How can you be a Christian and blindly follow a known liar, criminal and generally unethical person? I simply don‚Äôt understand it.

My credit card got locked yesterday due to a fraudulent transaction. Getting a new one next week. But guess what today is? Yep. It‚Äôs the 1st of August. And what happens on the 1st? Right. All the services want their payments and fees and subscriptions. Guess who‚Äôs getting ALL the emails today? üëçüèª
So the surgeon thinks it‚Äôs not an inflamed insect bite, but an inflamed sebaceous gland. Go figure. Either way, that sucker gets cut open on Tursday.
Watching Aquaman with the kids. Our son has made it his goal to watch all of Marvel and DC back to back. Aquaman is actually not that bad. Not great. But also not terrible.
Our son has looked up his Pok√©mon cards online and apparently some cards are worth several hundreds. Not sure how accurately these marketplace values are. But he seems happy. ü§∑

Tonight we are having session two of our DnD group. I‚Äôm hoping it goes better for the party then last session (where we had a TPK). Either way, they are all pumped and are having fun regardless. As will I.
My blood pressure is acting up again. Around noon it goes into free fall for a couple of hours rendering me pretty much useless. Will need to adjust my medication and hope that fixes it.

The progression of my son as he paints minis is obvious. (Owlbear at age six. Tiefling at age eleven.) However, the difference between him and his sister is astounding. She is four years behind him, but already paints as good as he does at age eleven. (Her‚Äòs is the Druid.)
Out and about eating ice cream.
Home again! Super happy to see my wife and kids again.
Good morning on day four of my hospital stay. This night was a night of horrors. A big thunderstorm with lots of lightning paired with several people screaming in pain through the night.
Day three at the hospital. I hope I‚Äôll be able toe toTor to leave tomorrow.
Day two at the hospital. Cabin fever already setting in. I hate staying at hospitals.

At the hospital. This time it‚Äôs me and I‚Äôm staying for a while. I have an inflamed abscess probably from an insect bite. That sucker grew larger over the last seven days and since yesterday I also have a fever. So now I‚Äôm on antibiotics and hospital surveillance for the next several days.

item.title: Foundry VTT self-hosting or using The Forge
item.description:
My Foundry VTT journey continues. Last Tuesday we had our first session of Lost Mines of Phandelver and I promptly kill our party. It was a bit unbalanced due to only two of four players showing up and them insisting to pretend like the other party members didn‚Äôt exist.

But we all still had fun and they instantly proceeded to create new characters.

Also, I‚Äôm slowly‚Äîor actually rather fast‚Äîrunning out of server space with all the extra modules I‚Äôm installing. Uberspace by default gives you 10GB of disk space, most of which is taken up by my wife‚Äôs email account. She‚Äôs not great at inbox zero‚Ä¶

Anyway, you can book an extra 10GB for ‚Ç¨3 a month, which I did. But now I‚Äôm also running close to that limit thanks to some modules that require several GB of space. And now I‚Äôm pondering where it is worth the extra ‚Ç¨6 a month to self-host and the flexibility that brings or if I should buy access to The Forge for about ‚Ç¨4,50 a month and safe myself the headache.
Why do printers still suck so much in 2024‚ÄΩ Wireless printing should not be such an issue still.
Session One of our Lost Mines of Phandelver DnD campaign starts tonight. I‚Äôm very excited.
Oh my god! I Just opened Skype after a year so of not using it. What the hell did they do to this app? I am bombarded with news streams and lots of stuff I don‚Äòt need in a chat app.
2:30pm be there.
Lots of tasty cakes and pies today at the 1250 years anniversary.
Man. It‚Äôs freezing today. Bloody weather doesn‚Äôt know what it wants. 31¬∞C yesterday and icy wind and rain today.
Church today and then another afternoon of 1250 years anniversary celebrations. I‚Äôm not particularly religious myself, but it‚Äôs a small village. Gotta have your Sunday church.
So far so good. Only a few drops of rain.
It looks me like people aren‚Äôt bothered by the approaching weather.
So there is a strong thunderstorm warning for tonight at 6pm, exactly when tonight‚Äôs festivities are supposed to start. Let‚Äôs see how that goes‚Ä¶
Transcript of the 2024 US Presidential Debate
Geinsheim‚Äôs 1250 years anniversary starts tonight at 6pm. Be there!

item.title: Love me some AI Generators for Foundry VTT
item.description:
I am having way too much fun building out my Foundry VTT world with AI tools. Lots of Theatre of the Mind images with the help of MidJourney, ElevenLabs voices provide narration, and now I have a singing bard thanks to suno.

I cannot wait for my players to experience it all.
Heute Mittag gibt‚Äôs Melonensalat

Just a quick service announcement. I am still in love with Uberspace. Their service rocks!

@hallo@uberspace.social
Thanks MidJourney. I could chill out there today.
Another hot day today. 30¬∞C and almost 80% humidity. This is going to be fun‚Ä¶
I just ran my first proper D&D session. It was chaotic. I did a decently poor job. And the players had great fun and I loved it.
Over three hours in the ER. And all that for a bandage. Sigh.
At the emergency room once again. Life with kids. What can I say? I guess once a year is the tradition in our household.
Back home and knackered. It was a great concert. The kids were great. All six thousand of them. :)
At SAP Arena for the 6K United concert. Our boy is among those 6K.
Feuerwehr Fest Geinsheim 2024 #dorfkultur
Spielplatz-Fest in Geinsheim
In town, sitting in the shade enjoying the rather quiet street while sipping my peppermint tea.

item.title: Foundry VTT Update
item.description:
Almost done converting the ‚ÄúThe Lost Mine of Phandelver‚Äù campaign into a Foundry VTT Game World. ‚úîÔ∏è Maps loaded in. ‚úîÔ∏è Walls and doors drawn ‚úîÔ∏è Enemies and other NPCs placed on map (shoutout to AI Monster Importer) ‚úîÔ∏è Imported the whole campaign text into Journals ‚úîÔ∏è Convert all ‚Äúread to the group‚Äù text into audio narration with the help of ElevenLabs‚Äô voice ‚ÄúJohn Doe - Intimate‚Äù

Still to be done:

  • Getting familiar with a few add-modules to make playtime smoother
  • Search out appropriate music and ambience sounds
Wow. ICQ was still around?? ICQ is shutting down

item.title: Foundry VTT and AI Voices via ElevenLabs
item.description:
I recently discovered Foundry VTT as a way to play role playing games with my friends from all over there the world.

I have spent a few days transferring a D&D campaign to digital format and it is coming together just greatly. Great maps with flickering lights, atmospheric background music.

And I even found a way to have all the story hooks being read by a great AI narrator via ElevenLabs. They have a great Michael Kramer like voice (John Doe - Intimate) and I was able to get the whole campaign vocalized for just ‚Ç¨5.

item.title: Switching hosting from MidPhase to Uberspace
item.description:
So, after another round of failed communications with my current web host MidPhase‚ÄîI have been waiting for over a week to hear back from support‚ÄîI have decided to move hosts.

I am now with Uberspace.

They had me interested for a long time now and I finally took the plunge and am loving it. Their business model is quite unique in that it is ‚Äúpay what you want‚Äù. No strings attached. Same service for everyone. If you see the value and can afford it, you pay more. If not less. Down to ‚Ç¨1/month.

Their interface is mostly SSH shell based, so one better be somewhat Terminal skilled.
Ha ha. Not touching the snake was not an option in the end. Both girls conquered their fear. And it seems both were proud of it.
Sadly the girls were too scared to touch a snake. :)
At the Landau Reptile Zoo with Willow and her friend. It‚Äôs nice and warm in here and lots of little critters to learn about.
The village is coming together for some vineyard singing.
#kindeyforum is over. Some interesting talks and some new acquaintances later we are heading home.
Today‚Äôs schedule. #kidneyforum
Pretty full. #kidneyforum
In Heidelberg beim Nierentransplantations-Forum. Es ist ganz gut besucht.

item.title: Provokativ!
item.description:
Found my notes for a local CDU campaign meetup. Posted here for posterities sake.

Provokativ!

Viel Palaver

Kein Ortsvorsteher weil die SPD auch keinen stellt. Lieber Mehrheit im Ortsbeirat

Mahnmal ist schlecht gelaufen. Als Beispiel warum es die CDU braucht. Die machen es richtig.

Sachverstand. Kompetenz. Offenheit. Erfahrung.

Wohnraum. Gr√ºne Lunge is Quatsch im Dorf.

Alleinige Verantwortung f√ºr verkehrsberuhigte Einfahrten. Und b39

Dorfgemeinschaft zwiegespalten. Will keine Namen nennen. ‚Ä¶

Langweilig
Getting into rowing. Dark Horse Rowing has a great intro series on YouTube. ‚Üí Rowing Fundamentals
Instead of striking back at Iran, Israel could should actual strength by showing restraint.
Sigh. Why do jobs always come in twos? I accepted a job yesterday. And today a second job comes a-knocking.

item.title: A really stubborn bug
item.description: This year‚Äôs winter was really tough in our area. There is some bug going around our social circle that just won‚Äôt go away. Pretty much everyone is constantly sick and coughing. And once one gets better, another one starts coughing. I really do hope now that it is getting warm outside, things will start to get better.
I‚Äôm making ragu a la bolognese right now for tomorrow‚Äôs lasagna. The smell in the kitchen is mouthwatering right now.

What‚Äôs for dinner? For us it‚Äôs steak with buttered veggies and rice. üçöü•©ü•ï

(Image courtesy of MidJourney)
I sometimes forget I am talking into a void here.
Happy April‚Äòs Fools! I didn‚Äòt see any joke news so far. Maybe I was blind. What were your favorite April‚Äòs fools jokes so far?
Happy Easter folks! ü•öüê∞
Pizza tonight! The kids are starved from being in the great outdoors for two days learning to make campfires and all that encompasses including fire safety. üçïüî•
Curious. I just updated iOS to 17.4 and am in the EU. Yet, I didn‚Äôt get any default browser prompt. Is that only the case when you have several browsers installed?
Just saw Dune - Part 2. Wow. The imagery was fantastic. Well told as well. Had me in tears at the end.
We did the Dracula escape room at Escape Rooms Mannheim today. It was great fun and we did beat it with 17 seconds to spare.
Oh jolly! The kids lost my Switch.

Currently reading: Dracula by Bram Stoker üìö I found a really nice edition in the bookstore the other day. Every few pages there are inserts like letters, postcards, foldable maps or recipes.

amzn.to/3IdaIid
Getting a iron infusion. Nothing like a little pickmeup on a Monday morning.
The organ tour was fun. Really interesting to see and actually step behind the pipes.
These are wooden rods that connect the organs keys to the pipes a few meters further up.
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
Tons of pipes.
One level down.
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
Behind the pipes.
At the top.
I suspect we are going up there later.
We are visiting a church this morning to get a tour of a disassembled pipe organ. Should be interesting.

item.title: Marvel‚Äôs Echo
item.description: Just finished watching Marvel‚Äôs Echo. It was underwhelming. There was a good underlying idea in there somewhere. I think. But by the final episode I still had no idea what it was supposed to be about. No clue about the main characters goals. But I love seeing Wilson Fisk portrayed by Vincent D‚ÄôOnofrio. I guess that is worth something. Overall though. Sadly one big ‚Äúmeh‚Äù.

I finally managed to import all my old long form articles to Micro.blog. Had to do a bit of manual adjustments of my Kirby export to get it to work, but overall it went rather smoothly (after @manton pointed me in the right direction).

item.title: Eschenfelder Grain Press
item.description: Baking bread again today. We got a grain press (as opposed to a grain mill) in January and I have incorporated pressed whole grains in my pizza and bread doughs since then. They add some great nutty flavors to the dough. Highly recommended.
BTW. @manton how is your support email queue looking? I vaguely remember writing your around end of 2023 about importing my Kirby posts and some error it throws. I haven‚Äòt heard anything so far.
Today I learned about the Republic of Molossia and have become a fan. I mean, what‚Äôs not to like? A toy train as the national railroad? A space program complete with toy rocket launch? Brilliant!
At an indoor playground for our little ones birthday party. 4 hours and I will leave a deaf man. üßè‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
